questions.Question: Article 359 of the Constitution authorizes the president of India to suspend the right to move any court for the enforcement of Fundamental Rights during :
questions.optionB: A failure of constitutional machinery in States
questions.solution: Solution:		Where a Proclamation of Emergency is in operation, the President may by order declare that the right to move any court for the enforcement of such of 1[the rights conferred by Part III (except articles 20 and 21)] as may be mentioned in the order and all proceedings pending in any court for the enforcement of the rights so mentioned shall remain suspended for the period during which the Proclamation is in force or for such shorter period as may be specified in the order.

questions.Question: The correct chronological order of the formation of Haryana, Sikkim, Arunanchal Pradesh and Nagaland as full states of Indian Union is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Nagaland on 1st December 1963. Haryana on 1st November 1966. Sikkim on 16th May 1975. Arunachal Pradesh on 20th Feb 1987.

questions.Question: The speaker of the Lok Sabha can ask a member of the house to stop speaking and let another member speak. This phenomenon is known as :
questions.solution: Solution:Yielding the floor. The speaker of the Lok sabha can ask a member of the house to stop speaking and let another member speak. Crossing the floor: Passing between the member addressing the House and the Chair which is considered breach of Parliamentary etiquette. Point of Order: A Member of Parliament may raise a point of order if he feels that the proceedings of' the House do not follow the normal rules. The presiding officer decides whether the point of order raised by the member should be allowed. Calling Attention Motion: With the prior permission of the Speaker, any member of the Parliament may call the attention of a Minister to a matter of urgent public importance. The Minister may make a brief statement about the matter or he may ask for time to make a statement later.

questions.Question: By which Constitutional Amendment Act was the number of Lok sabha seats increased from 525 to 545 ?
questions.solution: Solution:		31st Constitutional Amendment Act, 1973 - By this amendment the seats of Lok Sabha was increased from 525 to 545 but reduced the representatior of UT's in Lok Sabha from 25 to 20.

questions.Question: The first Backward Class commission was appointed in 1953 under the chairmanship of :
questions.solution: Solution:Kaka Kalelkar Commission:The Backward Class Commission was appointed in 1953 with Kaka Kalelkar as the Chairman. The Commission was asked to determine the criteria to be adopted to provide concessions to “socially and educationally backward classes” besides the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes; the Commission was also asked to prepare a list of such classes.

questions.Question: In India, the state which has the largest forest cover is:
questions.solution: Solution:		In India, the state which has the largest forest cover is Madhya Pradesh.

questions.Question: The Indian state which was the first to release state level Human Development Report in 1995 was:
questions.solution: Solution:		The Indian state which was the first to release state level Human Development Report in 1995 was Madhya Pradesh.

questions.Question: With the objective of  opening the insurance sector for private participation the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority Act (IRDA) was passed in:
questions.solution: Solution:		With the objective ofopening the insurance sector for private participation the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority Act (IRDA) was passed in the year 1999.

questions.Question: The share of road transport in total transportation of the country is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The share of road transport in total transportation of the country is 80%.

questions.Question: Project ‘Sankalp’ is associated with the elimination of:
questions.solution: Solution:		Project ‘Sankalp’ is associated with the elimination of AIDS/HIV.

questions.Question: Revenue of the state governments are raised from the following sources, except
questions.solution: Solution:		Revenue of the state governments are raised from the following sources, except agricultural income tax.

questions.Question: Since the inception of the co-operative movement, rural credits has been
questions.solution: Solution:		Since the inception of the co-operative movement, rural credits has been institutionalized, rationalized and cheapened.

questions.Question: If an economy is equilibrium at the point where plans to save and to invest are equal, then government expenditure must be
questions.solution: Solution:		If an economy is equilibrium at the point where plans to save and to invest are equal, then government expenditure must be equal to government income.

questions.Question: The co-operative credit societies have a
questions.solution: Solution:		A credit union is a member-owned financial cooperative, democratically controlled by its members. The Co-operative Credit Institutions in India can be classified as under a three-tier structure- Primary Credit Societies at the bottom; Central Co-operative Bank at the middle; and State Co-operative Bank at the top.

questions.Question:
Regional rural banks 

I=have limited area of operation 
II=have free access to liberal refinance facilities from NABARD 
III=are required to lend only to weaker sections
questions.solution: Solution:		Regional rural banks have limited area of operation and have free access to liberal refinance facilities from NABARD.

questions.Question: The banks are required to maintain a certain ratio between their cash in the hand and total assets. This is called
questions.solution: Solution:		The banks are required to maintain a certain ratio between their cash in the hand and total assets. This is called Statutory Liquid Ratio (SLR).

questions.Question: Reserve Bank of India was nationalized in the year
questions.solution: Solution:		RBI established in 1935 and nationalized in 1949.

questions.Question:
In India, rural incomes are generally lower than the urban incomes, which of the following reasons account for this? 

I=A large number of farmers are illiterate and know little about scientific agricultureII=Prices of primary products are lower than those of manufactured products 
III=Investment in agriculture has been low when compared to investment in industry
questions.solution: Solution:		In India, rural incomes are generally lower than the urban incomes, because large number of farmers are illiterate and know little about scientific agriculture, Prices of primary products are lower than those of manufactured products and Investment in agriculture has been low when compared to investment in industry.

questions.Question: National Agricultural Insurance Scheme replacing Comprehensive Crop Insurance Scheme was introduced in the year
questions.solution: Solution:		National Agricultural Insurance Scheme replacing Comprehensive Crop Insurance Scheme was introduced in the year 1999.

questions.Question: If the fiscal deficit of the Union Government is Rs. 75,000 crores relending to State is Rs. 25,000 crores, interest payments are Rs. 25,000 crores, what is the amount of the primary deficit?
questions.solution: Solution:		If the fiscal deficit of the Union Government is Rs. 75,000 crores relending to State is Rs. 25,000 crores, interest payments are Rs. 25,000 crores, the amount of primary deficit is Rs. 50,000 crores.

questions.Question: During which five Year plan was phase of heavy industrialization initiated?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Second Five-Year plan accorded highest priority to Industrialisation. The plan was based on famous Mahalanobis Model. Mahalanobis model set out the task of establishing basic and capital goods industries on a large scale to create a strong base for the industrial development.

questions.Question: The Mid Day Meal scheme was launched on
questions.solution: Solution:		National Programme of Mid Day Meal in Schools. With a view to enhance enrolment, attendance, retention and simultaneously to improve the nutritional status of children, a Centrally Sponsored Scheme 'National Programme of Nutritional Support to Primary Education (NP-NSPE)' was launched on 15th August, 1995.

questions.Question: Who is responsible for establishing and maintaining astound and efficient accounting and financial reporting system in India?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Comptroller General of Accounts (CGA) in the Department of Expenditure, Ministry of Finance is the Principle Accounting Advisor to the Government of India on accounting matters and is responsible for establishing and maintaining a sound and efficient accounting and financial reporting system.

questions.Question: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) was established on:
questions.solution: Solution:		The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is the regulator of the securities and commodity market in India owned by the Government of India. It was established on 12 April 1988 and given Statutory Powers on 30 January 1992 through the SEBI Act, 1992.

questions.Question: The Ministry and programme Implementation - as an independent Ministry came into existence on :
questions.solution: Solution:		The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation came into existence as an Independent Ministry on 15.10.1999 after the merger of the Department of Statistics and the Department of Programme Implementation.

questions.Question: Since 1983, the RBI's responsibility with respect to regional rural banks was transferred to
questions.solution: Solution:		NABARD was established on 12 July 1982 to implement the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development Act 1981. It replaced the Agricultural Credit Department (ACD) and Rural Planning and Credit Cell (RPCC) of Reserve Bank of India, and Agricultural Refinance and Development Corporation (ARDC). It is one of the premier agencies providing developmental credit in rural areas. NABARD is India's specialised bank for Agriculture and Rural Development in India.

questions.Question: Deficit financing implies
questions.optionB: replacing new currency with worn out currency
questions.optionC: public expenditure in excess of public revenue
questions.optionD: public revenue in excess of public expenditure
questions.solution: Solution:		Deficit financing means generating funds to finance the deficit which results from excess of expenditure over revenue. The gap being covered by borrowing from the public by the sale of bonds or by printing new money.

questions.Question: In which of the following sequences the change in quantity of money leads to change in price level in the Keynesian models?
questions.optionA: Change in quantity of money - change in investment - change in employment and output - change in rate of interest - change in price level
questions.optionB: Change in quantity of money - change in employment and output - change in investment - change in the rate of interest - change in price level
questions.optionC: Change in quantity of money - change in investment - change in rate of interest - change in employment and output - change in price level
questions.optionD: Change in quantity of money - change in rate of interest - change in investment - change in employment and output - change in price level
questions.solution: Solution:		The sequence is Change in quantity of money - change in rate of interest - change in investment - change in employment and output - change in price level.

questions.Question: Foreign Direct Investment ceiling in the telecom sector have been raised from 74 percent to
questions.solution: Solution:		Foreign Direct Investment ceiling in the telecom sector have been raised from 74 percent to 100 percent.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a part of machinery that settles industrial disputes?
questions.solution: Solution:		Wage Court is not a part of machinery that settles industrial disputes.

questions.Question: Excess of Total Expenditure over total Receipts is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Excess of Total Expenditure over total Receipts is Deficit Budget.

questions.Question: In India the first bank of limited liability managed by Indian and founded in 1881 was:
questions.solution: Solution:		In India the first bank of limited liability managed by Indian and founded in 1881 was Oudh commercial Bank.

questions.Question: Which company has started a rural marketing network called e-Chaupals?
questions.solution: Solution:		ITC has started a rural marketing network called e-Chaupals.

questions.Question: The first multi–purpose river valley project of independent India is:
questions.solution: Solution:		Damodar Valley Corporation (DVC) was the first multipurpose project of independent India. DVC operates several hydel power stations constructed on Damodar river.

questions.Question: India’s share in textiles trade of the world is:
questions.solution: Solution:		India’s share in textiles trade of the world is 6%.

questions.Question: States earn maximum revenue through
questions.solution: Solution:		States earn maximum revenue through commercial taxes.

questions.Question: Our financial system has provided for the transfer of resources from the centre to the states; the important means of resource transfers are
questions.solution: Solution:		Our financial system has provided for the transfer of resources from the centre to the states; the important means of resource transfers are tax sharing, grant-in-aids and loans.

questions.Question: Debenture holders of a company are its
questions.solution: Solution:		Debenture holders of a company are its creditors.

questions.Question: Excise duty is a tax levied on the
questions.solution: Solution:		Excise duty refers to the taxes levied on the manufacture of goods within the country, as opposed to custom duty that is levied on goods coming from outside the country.

questions.Question: In pursuance with the recommendations of Narsimham Committee, the RBI has framed new guidelines
questions.optionA: to govern entry of new private sector banks to make the banking sector more competitive
questions.optionB: to reduce the freedom given to banks to rationalize their existing branch network
questions.optionC: to setup more foreign exchange banks
questions.optionD: to lend more easily for industrial development
questions.solution: Solution:		In pursuance with the recommendations of Narsimham Committee, the RBI has framed new guidelines to govern entry of new private sector banks to make the banking sector more competitive.

questions.Question: Rice, Millet (Jawar-Bajra ), Maize and cotton is the group which belongs to:
questions.solution: Solution:		Rice, Millet (Jawar-Bajra ), Maize and cotton is the group which belongs to Kharif crop.

questions.Question:
The central banking functions in India are performed by the

I=Central Bank of India 
II=Reserve Bank of India 
III=State Bank of India 
IV=Punjab National Bank
questions.solution: Solution:		The central banking functions in India are performed by the Reserve Bank of India.

questions.Question: Development expenditure of the Central government does not include
questions.optionC: expenditure on social and community services
questions.solution: Solution:		Expenditure on economic service, expenditure on social and communist services, grant to states are examples of developmental expenditures. Among the given options, defense expenditure is not an example of developmental expenditure.

questions.Question: ICICI is the name of a
questions.solution: Solution:		ICICI Bank was established by the Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India (ICICI), an Indian financial institution, as a wholly owned subsidiary in 1994 in Vadodara.

questions.Question: Gilt-edged market means
questions.solution: Solution:		The gilt-edged market is the market in government securities or the securities guaranteed (as to both principal and interest) by the government. The term gilt-edged means 'of the best quality”. It has come to be reserved for government securities as they do not suffer from the risk of default.

questions.Question: One of the reasons for India's occupational structure remaining more or less the same over the years has been that
questions.optionA: investment pattern has been directed towards capital intensive industries
questions.optionB: productivity in agriculture has been high enough to induce people to stay with agriculture
questions.optionC: ceiling on land holdings have enabled more people to own land and hence their preference to stay wit
questions.optionD: people are largely unaware of the significance of transition from agriculture to industry for econom
questions.solution: Solution:		One of the reasons for India's occupational structure remaining more or less the same over the years has been that investment pattern has been directed towards capital intensive industries.

questions.Question: Gross domestic capital formation is defined as
questions.optionA: flow of expenditure devoted to increased or maintaining of the capital stock
questions.optionB: expenditure incurred on physical assets only
questions.optionD: net addition to stock after depreciation
questions.solution: Solution:		Gross domestic capital formation refers to the net increase in the physical asset by the household, public, and government sector within the measurement period of the economy.Dec 26, 2019

questions.Question: On July 12, 1982, the ARDC was merged into
questions.solution: Solution:		On July 12, 1982, the ARDC was merged into NABARD.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the most appropriate cause of export surplus?
questions.optionC: Developments in national and international markets
questions.solution: Solution:		Developments in national and international market is the most appropriate cause of export surplus.

questions.Question: If the cash reserve ratio is lowered by the RBI, its impact on credit creation will be to
questions.solution: Solution:		If the cash reserve ratio is lowered by the RBI, its impact on credit creation will be to increase it.

questions.Question: In India Yellow revolution is associated with:
questions.solution: Solution:		In India Yellow revolution is associated with the production of oil seeds.

questions.Question: The programme which was launched in 1974-75 with the main objectives of improving the utilization of created irrigation potential is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The programme which was launched in 1974-75 with the main objectives of improving the utilization of created irrigation potential is Command Area Development (CAD).

questions.Question: The first fully Indian Bank is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The first fully Indian Bank is Punjab National Bank.

questions.Question: Indian state with highest road length is:
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian state with highest road length is Maharashtra.

questions.Question: The total number of national highways in the country is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The total number of national highways in the country is 228.

questions.Question: Green Banking channel has been launched by:
questions.solution: Solution:		Green Banking channel has been launched by State Bank of India.

questions.Question: Which state of India ranks first in milk production as per the data of the year 2009-10?
questions.solution: Solution:		Uttar Pradesh ranks first in milk production as per the data of year 2009-10.

questions.Question: Navaratna Status is concerned with:
questions.solution: Solution:		Navaratna Status is concerned with Public Sector Companies.

questions.Question: What was the central theme of the Chipko Movement started by Sunderlal Bahuguna in 1973?
questions.solution: Solution:		The name of the movement comes from the word 'Embrace', as the villagers hugged the trees, and prevented the contractors' from felling them. The main aim of the Chipko Movement or Chipko Andolan was to protect the trees of the forests to be cut. It was basically a forest conservation movement.

questions.Question: Finance Commission is constituted after every:
questions.solution: Solution:		Finance Commission is constituted after every 5 years.

questions.Question: Which of the following items would not appear in a company's balance sheet?
questions.optionA: Value of stocks of raw materials held
questions.optionC: Revenue from sales of the company's products
questions.solution: Solution:		Revenue from sales of the company's products would not appear in a company's balance sheet.

questions.Question: The currency convertibility concept in its original form originated in
questions.solution: Solution:		The currency convertibility concept in its original form originated in Bretton Woods Agreement.

questions.Question: In the state of India, the State Financial Corporation have given assistance mainly to develop
questions.solution: Solution:		In the state of India, the State Financial Corporation have given assistance mainly to develop medium and small-scale industries.

questions.Question: The central co-operative banks are in direct touch with
questions.solution: Solution:		The central co-operative banks are in direct touch with State Co-operative Banks.

questions.Question: The first wholly Indian Bank was set up in
questions.solution: Solution:		Allahabad bank is the 1st wholly old Indian bank. The first bank in India is Hindustan bank of India in 1894, Calcutta which earlier name of state bank of India.

questions.Question: In the last one decade, which one among the following sectors has attracted the highest foreign direct investment inflows into India?
questions.solution: Solution:		In the last one decade, telecommunication has attracted the highest foreign direct investment inflows into India?

questions.Question: Devaluation of a currency means
questions.optionA: fall in exchange value of a country by market forces
questions.optionB: reduction in external value/exchange value of currency by the government
questions.optionC: reduction in currency value due to wear and tear
questions.solution: Solution:		When the country follows a fixed exchange rate regime the government constantly has to revalue and devalue the currency in order to maintain the pegged exchange rate. When there is upwards market pressure on the currency to appreciate, the central bank will artificially devalue the currency by buying up foreign reserves.

questions.Question: In the second nationalization of commercial banks, ___ banks were nationalized.
questions.solution: Solution:		In the second nationalization of commercial banks, 6 banks were nationalized.

questions.Question:
Since independence, both development and non-development expenditures have increased; the increase in the former being a little more than in the other. Non-development expenditure involves

I=interest payments 
II=subsidies 
III=defence 
IV=irrigation
questions.solution: Solution:		Since independence, both development and non-development expenditures have increased; the increase in the former being a little more than in the other. Non-development expenditure involves interest payments, subsidies and defence.

questions.Question: Depreciation means
questions.optionA: closure of a plant due to lock out
questions.optionB: closure of a plant due to labour trouble
questions.optionC: loss of equipment over time due to wear and tear
questions.optionD: destruction of a plant in a fire accident
questions.solution: Solution:		Depreciation means a reduction in the value of an asset over time, due in particular to wear and tear.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not an undertaking under the administrative control of Ministry of Railways?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Railways Construction Company Limited is not an undertaking under the administrative control of Ministry of Railways.

questions.Question: If the RBI adopted an expansionist open market operations policy, this means that it will
questions.optionB: sell securities in the open market
questions.optionC: offer commercial banks more credit in the open market
questions.optionD: openly announce to the market that it intends to expand credit
questions.solution: Solution:		If the RBI adopted an expansionist open market operations policy, this means that it will offer commercial banks more credit in the open market.

questions.Question: Redistribution polices geared to reduce economic inequalities include
questions.solution: Solution:		Redistribution polices geared to reduce economic inequalities include progressive tax policies, land reforms and rural development policies.

questions.Question: Short-term finance is usually for a period ranging up to
questions.solution: Solution:		Short-term finance is usually for a period ranging up to 12 months.

questions.Question: In India, which one among the following formulates the fiscal policy?
questions.solution: Solution:		In India, Ministry of Finance formulates the fiscal policy.

questions.Question: Meera Seth committee was related to:
questions.solution: Solution:		Meera Seth committee was related to development of handlooms.

questions.Question: National Income estimates in India is prepared by:
questions.solution: Solution:		National Income estimates in India is prepared by Central Statistical Organisation (CSO).

questions.Question: Earn While you Learn scheme has been launched by:
questions.solution: Solution:		Earn While you Learn scheme has been launched by Ministry of Tourism.

questions.Question: The first national commission on labours was constituted on:
questions.solution: Solution:		The first National Commission on Labour was set up on 24 December 1966 under the Chairmanship of Justice P.B. Gajendragadkar. The Commission submitted its report in August , 1969 after detailed examination of all aspects of labour problems, both in the organised and unorganised sectors.

questions.Question: Monopolies and restrictive Trade practices (MRTP) act was passed in:
questions.solution: Solution:		The Monopolies and Restrictive Trade Practices Act (MRTP Act) was passed by Parliament of India on 18 December 1969 and got president's assent on December 27, 1969 but it came into force from June 1, 1970.

questions.Question: Whose name is associated with formulation of planning strategy in Second five Year plan?
questions.solution: Solution:		Prasanta Chandra Mahalanobis is associated with formulation of planning strategy in Second five Year plan.

questions.Question: In November 2007, the finance commission constituted by the president of India was:
questions.solution: Solution:		In November 2007, the finance commission constituted by the president of India was thirteenth.

questions.Question: Meera Seth committee was associated with:
questions.solution: Solution:		Meera Seth committee was associated with the development of Handloom industry.

questions.Question: Reserve Bank of India will soon release plastic notes in circulation will be of :
questions.solution: Solution:		Reserve Bank of India will soon release plastic notes in circulation will be of Rs 10 notes.

questions.Question: Where was first gold refinery established?
questions.solution: Solution:		First gold refinery was established at Shirpur (Maharashtra).

questions.Question: In Global Hunger Index (GHI) India has been ranked at:
questions.solution: Solution:		In Global Hunger Index (GHI) India has been ranked at 102nd place among 117 developing countries.

questions.Question: In coal production, India ranks in the world:
questions.solution: Solution:		In coal production, India ranks in the world at Third place(after China and America).

questions.Question: The number of finance commissions set up upto now is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The number of finance commissions set up upto now is 15.

questions.Question: In April 1980 how many banks were nationalized?
questions.solution: Solution:		In April 1980 six banks were nationalized.

questions.Question: How many Regional Rural Bank (RRBs) are working in the country till 31st March,2010?
questions.solution: Solution:		82 Regional Rural Bank (RRBs) are working in the country till 31st March, 2010.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the first Indian private company to sign an accord with Government of Myanmar for oil exploration in two offshore blocks in that country?
questions.solution: Solution:		Essar Oil is the first Indian private company to sign an accord with Government of Myanmar for oil exploration in two offshore blocks in that country.

questions.Question: Non Tax revenues can be increased by improving the working of the
questions.solution: Solution:		Non Tax revenues can be increased by improving the working of the commercial irrigation projects.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not viewed as a national debt?
questions.solution: Solution:		National Saving Certificate is not viewed as a national debt.

questions.Question: The condition of indirect taxes in the country's revenue is approximately
questions.solution: Solution:		The condition of indirect taxes in the country's revenue is approximately 86 percent.

questions.Question: Deficit financing means that the government borrows money from the
questions.solution: Solution:		Deficit financing means that the government borrows money from the RBI.

questions.Question: The budget deficit means
questions.optionA: the excess of total expenditure, including loans, net of lending over revenue receipts
questions.optionB: difference between revenue receipts and revenue expenditure
questions.optionC: difference between all receipts and all the expenditure
questions.solution: Solution:		The budget deficit means difference between all receipts and all the expenditure.

questions.Question: If utensils worth Rs 1000 are produced with copper worth Rs 500, wages paid are Rs 100, other material purchased is worth Rs 100 and depreciation of machinery is zero, then what is the value added in process?
questions.solution: Solution:		If utensils worth Rs 1000 are produced with copper worth Rs 500, wages paid are Rs 100, other material purchased is worth Rs 100 and depreciation of machinery is zero, then the value added in process is Rs 300.

questions.Question: Paper currency first started in India in
questions.solution: Solution:		The Paper Currency Act of 1861 gave the Government the monopoly of note issued throughout the vast expanse of British India.

questions.Question: The ARDC is now a branch of the
questions.solution: Solution:		The ARDC is now a branch of the NABARD.

questions.Question: Devaluation of currency leads to
questions.solution: Solution:		Devaluation is the decision to reduce the value of a currency in a fixed exchange rate. A devaluation means that the value of the currency falls. Domestic residents will find imports and foreign travel more expensive. However domestic exports will benefit from their exports becoming cheaper.

questions.Question: Unit Trust of India (UTI) was established in:
questions.solution: Solution:		Unit Trust of India (UTI) was established in 1964.

questions.Question: SEBI which was established in April 1988 stands for:
questions.optionA: Share and Exchange Board of India
questions.optionB: Securities and Exchange Board of India
questions.optionC: Securities and Exchange Bureau of India
questions.optionD: Security and Economic Board of India
questions.solution: Solution:		Securities and exchange Board of India (SEBI) was first established in the year 1988 as a non-statutory body for regulating the securities market. It became an autonomous body by The Government of India on 12 May 1992.

questions.Question: As per the targets of 11th Five year Plan (2007-12) Mortality Rate (2012) has been targeted at:
questions.solution: Solution:		As per the targets of 11th Five year Plan (2007-12) Mortality Rate (2012) has been targeted at 1 per 1000 births.

questions.Question: When personal direct taxes are subtracted from personal income the obtained value is called:
questions.solution: Solution:		When personal direct taxes are subtracted from personal income the obtained value is called Gross National Product (GNP)

questions.Question: As per the Prime Minister’s Economic Advisory Council (PMEAC) Economic Outlook 2011-12, Indian economy is expected to expand by:
questions.solution: Solution:		As per the Prime Minister’s Economic Advisory Council (PMEAC) Economic Outlook 2011-12, Indian economy is expected to expand by 8.0% in 2011-12.

questions.Question: Fiscal  deficit in the Union Budget means
questions.optionA: the difference between current expenditure and current revenue
questions.optionB: net increase in Union Governments borrowings from the Reserve Bank of India
questions.optionC: the sum of budgetary deficit and net increase in internal and external borrowings
questions.optionD: the sum of monetized deficit and budgetary deficit
questions.solution: Solution:		Fiscal deficit in the Union Budget means the sum of budgetary deficit and net increase in internal and external borrowings.

questions.Question: How many banks were nationalized in 1969?
questions.solution: Solution:		14 banks were nationalized in 1969.

questions.Question: In India, the first bank of limited liability managed by Indians and founded in 1881 was
questions.solution: Solution:		In India, the first bank of limited liability managed by Indians and founded in 1881 was Oudh Commercial Bank.

questions.Question: In India, inflation measured by the
questions.optionB: Consumers Price Index for urban non-manual workers
questions.optionC: Consumers Price Index for agricultural workers
questions.solution: Solution:		 Two major measures for inflation, which are widely used, are Wholesale Price Index (WPI) and Consumer Price Index (CPI). WPI measures the increase in the prices of a fixed basket of goods prevailing in the wholesale market while CPI measures the increase in the prices of essential commodities purchased by an average consumer prevailing in the retail market. Measured weekly, WPI is the primary inflation measure in India.

questions.Question: The annual yield from which of the following Union Government taxes is the highest?
questions.optionC: Inheritance tax, wealth tax, interest tax and gift tax
questions.solution: Solution:		The annual yield from excise duties is the highest.

questions.Question: A proportion of the total deposits and reserves of the commercial banks that is to be kept with the Central Bank (RBI) on liquid form as a measure of control of RBI over the Commercial Banks is known as:
questions.solution: Solution:		A proportion of the total deposits and reserves of the commercial banks that is to be kept with the Central Bank (RBI) on liquid form as a measure of control of RBI over the Commercial Banks is known as Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR).

questions.Question: Inflation is measured in India on the basis of which ‘Index’?
questions.optionB: Consumer Price Index for urban workers
questions.optionC: Consumer Price Index for agricultural workers
questions.solution: Solution:		In India, Consumer Price Index (CPI) and Wholesale Price Index (WPI) are two major indices for measuring inflation. In United States, CPI and PPI (Producer Price Index) are two major indices. The Wholesale Price Index (WPI) was main index for measurement of inflation in India till April 2014 when RBI adopted new Consumer Price Index (CPI) (combined) as the key measure of inflation.

questions.Question: In India, the second largest provider of employment after agriculture is:
questions.solution: Solution:		In India, the second largest provider of employment after agriculture is Textile Sector.

questions.Question: In the World, in the production of cotton, India ranks:
questions.solution: Solution:		In the World, in the production of cotton, India ranks second.

questions.Question: The Foreign Exchange Management Act(FEMA) was passed in:
questions.solution: Solution:		The Foreign Exchange Management Act(FEMA) was passed in the year 1999.

questions.Question: Aam Admi Bima Yojana was launched on:
questions.solution: Solution:		The Aam Admi Bima Yojana was launched on 2nd October 2007. It is a social security scheme that is targeted toward the low-income families of India.

questions.Question: Planning commission constituted a high level committee for financial sector reforms in August 2007 under the Chairmanship of:
questions.solution: Solution:		The Raghuram Rajan Committee on Financial Sector Reforms was a committee constituted by the Government of India in 2007 for proposing the next generation of financial sector reforms in India.

questions.Question: Who gave the call for Evergreen Revolution?
questions.solution: Solution:		Father of the Green Revolution in India and renowned farm scientist M S Swaminathan has given the call for 'evergreen revolution', “which implies productivity improvement in perpetuity without ecological and social harm.

questions.Question: Open market operation is a part of:
questions.solution: Solution:		Open market operation is a part of Credit Policy.

questions.Question: Income tax in India was introduced by:
questions.solution: Solution:		The 19th century saw the establishment of British rule in India. Following the Mutiny of 1857, the British government faced an acute financial crisis. To fill up the treasury, the first Income-tax Act was introduced in February 1860 by James Wilson, who became British-India's first Finance Minister.

questions.Question: As per the 2009-10, data the commodity with highest share in total export value was:
questions.solution: Solution:		As per the 2009-10, data the commodity with highest share in total export value was Gems and Jewellery.

questions.Question: The chairman of 13th finance Commission was:
questions.solution: Solution:		The chairman of 13th finance Commission was Vijay L. Kelkar.

questions.Question: The Ex-Officio Secretary of National Development Council is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The Ex-Officio Secretary of National Development Council is Secretary of Planning Commission.

questions.Question: The largest producer of Coffee in the country is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The largest producer of Coffee in the country is Karnataka.

questions.Question: The national food for work programme was launched in:
questions.solution: Solution:		NFWP stands for National Food for Work Program . It is launched by the Ministry of Rural Development, Central Government of India in November 2004. Under this scheme, 150 backward districts are provided with the necessary resources.

questions.Question: National Rural Health mission was launched in:
questions.solution: Solution:		The National Rural Health Mission (NRHM) was launched by the Hon'ble Prime Minister on 12th April 2005, to provide accessible, affordable and quality health care to the rural population, especially the vulnerable groups.

questions.Question: Laadli Laxmi Yojana has been launched for supporting girls of all religions and caste up to their marriage by:
questions.solution: Solution:		Laadli Laxmi Yojana has been launched for supporting girls of all religions and caste up to their marriage by Madhya Pradesh Government.

questions.Question: Government has merged Annapurna Scheme with:
questions.solution: Solution:		The Annapurna Scheme has been launched with effect from 1st April 2000. It aims at providing food security to meet the requirement of those senior citizens who, though eligible, have remained uncovered under the National Old Age Pension Scheme (NOAPS). Both the schemes have been merged for better implementation.

questions.Question: National Electricity Policy envisages elimination of power shortage by 2012 through addition of:
questions.solution: Solution:		National Electricity Policy envisages elimination of power shortage by 2012 through addition of 100000 Megawatt.

questions.Question: For International money transfer which Indian public sector bank has signed MoU with MoneyGram company of America?
questions.solution: Solution:		For International money transfer Punjab National Bank has signed MoU with MoneyGram company of America.

questions.Question: The average rate of domestic savings (gross) for the Indian economy is currently estimated to be in the range of
questions.solution: Solution:		The average rate of domestic savings (gross) for the Indian economy is currently estimated to be in the range of 20 to 25 percent.

questions.Question: Subsidies mean
questions.optionA: payment by government for purchase of goods and services
questions.optionB: payment made by business enterprises to factors of production
questions.optionC: payment made by companies to shareholders
questions.optionD: payment made by the government to business enterprises, without buying any goods and services
questions.solution: Solution:		Subsidies mean a sum of money granted by the state or a public body to help an industry or business keep the price of a commodity or service low.

questions.Question: National expenditure includes
questions.solution: Solution:		All of the above.

questions.Question: Resurgent India bonds were issued in US dollar, Pound Sterling and
questions.solution: Solution:		Resurgent India bonds were issued in US dollar, Pound Sterling and Deutsche Mark.

questions.Question: The apex body for formulating plans and coordinating research work in agriculture and allied fields is
questions.optionC: National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD)
questions.solution: Solution:		The apex body for formulating plans and coordinating research work in agriculture and allied fields is Indian Council of Agricultural Research.

questions.Question: With which country did India’s comprehensive Economic partnership Agreement come into effect on August 1, 2011?
questions.solution: Solution:		A Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) was signed between India and Japan on 16th February 2011 and it came into force from 1st August, 2011.

questions.Question: National food for Work programme aimed at intensifying the generation of supplementary wage employment was launched in:
questions.solution: Solution:		National Food for Work Programme was launched on November 14, 2004 in 150 most backward districts of the country with the objective of intensifying the generation of supplementary wage employment.

questions.Question: The Money Order system in India was introduced in the year :
questions.solution: Solution:		The Money Order system in India was introduced in the year 1880.

questions.Question: In the world in terms of Railway Network system India ranks:
questions.solution: Solution:		In the world in terms of Railway Network system India ranks fourth.

questions.Question: In India the term Black Revolution is associated with:
questions.optionA: Self-dependence in the production of coal
questions.optionC: Self-dependence in the production of petroleum crude oil
questions.optionD: Self-dependence in the production of balck corp
questions.solution: Solution:		Crude petroleum is originally found in black colour. It is also known as 'Black Gold'. In order to increase the production of crude oil, the term "Black Revolution" was coined in India.

questions.Question: Deficit financing leads to inflation in general, but it can be checked if
questions.optionA: government expenditure leads to increase in the aggregate supply in ratio of aggregate demand
questions.optionC: all the expenditure is denoted national debt payment only
questions.solution: Solution:		Deficit financing leads to inflation in general, but it can be checked if government expenditure leads to increase in the aggregate supply in ratio of aggregate demand, only aggregate demand is increased and all the expenditure is denoted national debt payment only.

questions.Question: If all the banks in an economy are nationalized and converted into a monopoly bank, the total deposits
questions.solution: Solution:		If all the banks in an economy are nationalized and converted into a monopoly bank, the total deposits will neither increase nor decrease.

questions.Question: India changed over to the decimal system of coinage in
questions.solution: Solution:		India shifted to decimal system of coinage in April 1957. 'Naya paisa' is the legend that can be seen in the new coins printed between 1957-1964.

questions.Question: The association of the rupee with pound sterling as the intervention currency was broken in
questions.solution: Solution:		The association of the rupee with pound sterling as the intervention currency was broken in 1992.

questions.Question: On which one of the following is the benefits received principle of taxation to achieve optimality bases?
questions.optionD: Ability to pay for the benefit
questions.solution: Solution:		On ability to pay for the benefit is the benefits received principle of taxation to achieve optimality bases.

questions.Question: The Board of Industrial and Financial Reconstruction (BIFR) came into existence in
questions.solution: Solution:		The Board of Industrial and Financial Reconstruction (BIFR) came into existence in 1987.

questions.Question: The current price index (base 1960) is nearly 330. This means that
questions.optionA: all items cost 3-3 times more than what they did in 1960
questions.optionB: the prices of certain selected items have gone up to 3-3 times
questions.optionC: weighted means of prices of certain item has increased 3-3 times
questions.optionD: gold price has gone up 3-3 times
questions.solution: Solution:		The current price index (base 1960) is nearly 330. This means that weighted means of prices of certain item has increased 3-3 times.

questions.Question: Notes on which denomination has the portrait of Mahatma Gandhi printed on them?
questions.solution: Solution:		All of the above

questions.Question: Devaluation of currency will be more beneficial if
questions.optionA: prices of domestic goods remain constant
questions.solution: Solution:Under a fixed exchange rate system, devaluation and revaluation are official changes in the value of a country's currency relative to other currencies. Under a floating exchange rate system, market forces generate changes in the value of the currency, known as currency depreciation or appreciation. Devaluation is a monetary policy tool used by countries that have a fixed exchange rate or semi-fixed exchange rate. One reason a country may devaluate its currency is to combat trade imbalances. Devaluation causes a country's exports to become less expensive, making them more competitive in the global market. Currency war, also known as competitive devaluations, is a condition in international affairs where countries seek to gain a trade advantage over other countries by causing the exchange rate of their currency to fall in relation to other currencies. Devaluation of currency will be more beneficial if prices of exports remain constant. After a devaluation, the new lower value of the domestic currency will make it less expensive for foreign consumers to obtain local currency with which to buy locally produced export goods, so more exports will be sold, helping domestic businesses. Further, the new exchange rate will make it more expensive for local consumers to obtain foreign currency with which to import foreign goods, hurting domestic consumers and causing less to be imported. The combined effect will be to reduce or eliminate the previous net outflow of foreign currency reserves from the central bank, so if the devaluation has been to a great enough extent the new exchange rate will be maintainable without foreign currency reserves being depleted any further.Source : gkplanet.com

questions.Question: Of the gross tax revenue of the Union Government the indirect taxes account for nearly
questions.solution: Solution:		Of the gross tax revenue of the Union Government the indirect taxes account for nearly 65 percent.

questions.Question: The main rubber producing state in the country is:
questions.solution: Solution:		The main rubber producing state in the country is Kerala.

questions.Question: At present, the number of nationalized banks are:
questions.solution: Solution:		At present, the number of nationalized banks are 12. 1 - Bank of Baroda 2 - Bank of India 3 - Bank of Maharashtra 4 - Canara Bank 5 - Central Bank of India 6 - Indian Bank 7 - Indian Overseas bank 8 - Punjab and Sind Bank 9 - Punjab National Bank 10 - State Bank of India 11 - UCO Bank 12 - Union Bank of India

questions.Question: During which five year plan was the annual growth rate registered at 2.5%?
questions.solution: Solution:		During Third five year plan was the annual growth rate registered at 2.5%.

questions.Question: The first Apparel Park in India has been established in:
questions.solution: Solution:		The first Apparel Park in India has been established in Tirupur(Tamil Nadu).

questions.Question: Unit Trust of India (UTI) was bifurcated (into UTI-I and UTI-II) in:
questions.solution: Solution:		Unit Trust of India (UTI) was bifurcated (into UTI-I and UTI-II) in the year 2003.
